index_column_help_table: The selected column will be used as index to organize tables
index_column_help_graph: The selected column will be used as X axis for graphs

combined_graph_info: All columns are displayed in the same graph. Uncheck the option above to see separate graphs.
file_input_mode_help: Choose whether you want to upload new files or select existing File resources from the laboratory

logistic_growth_description: Fits **logistic growth curves** to your time-series data with cross-validation.
spline_growth_description: Infers **maximum growth rate** using spline smoothing with cross-validation.
spline_growth_ideal_for: Ideal for: non-standard growth, multi-phase, or focus on growth rate only
index_column_help: Column to use as X axis (usually time or temperature)
data_column_help: Column containing data to fit (OD, biomass, etc.)
n_splits_help: Number of partitions for K-Fold cross-validation
spline_smoothing_help: Smoothing parameter for preprocessing (lower = less smoothing)
smoothing_min_help: Minimum smoothing parameter to test (lower = less smoothing)
smoothing_max_help: Maximum smoothing parameter to test (higher = more smoothing)
n_s_values_help: Number of smoothing values to test
analysis_running_reload: Analysis is running. Reload the page to see results.
no_logistic_analysis: No logistic growth analysis has been launched yet.
no_spline_analysis: No spline analysis has been launched yet.
analysis_not_finished: Analysis is not yet complete or encountered an error.
smoothed_curves_info: Left: smoothed curves | Right: growth rate (derivative)
cannot_retrieve_qc_resourceset: Unable to retrieve interpolated ResourceSet output from Quality Check
cannot_retrieve_qc_data: Unable to retrieve Quality Check data.
no_index_columns_found: No index columns (time/temperature) found in data.
no_data_columns_found: No data columns found in data.
pca_info_intro: This page allows you to launch a principal component analysis (PCA) on culture media compositions to identify relationships between different media used in your experiments.
pca_data_info: Data is automatically extracted from available plate reader experiments.
pca_select_media: Select media to include in the PCA analysis
pca_decimal_info: The decimal separator used in your media files (typically '.' for English format or ',' for French format)
pca_no_analyses: No PCA analyses have been launched yet.
pca_select_media_warning: Please select at least 2 media for PCA analysis.
pca_analysis_not_finished: The PCA analysis is not yet finished or encountered an error.
feature_extraction_info_intro: This page allows you to launch a feature extraction analysis on growth curve data. The analysis fits growth models to the data and extracts key parameters.
feature_extraction_data_column_help: The column containing optical density or other growth measurement values
feature_extraction_well_column_help: The column used to group data by wells/samples
feature_extraction_model_help: Choose the mathematical model to fit to the growth curves
feature_extraction_no_analyses: No feature extraction analyses have been launched yet.
feature_extraction_multi_scenario_info: The analysis can process multiple scenarios simultaneously. Select all scenarios to include.
feature_extraction_select_scenario_warni: Please select at least one Quality Check scenario.
feature_extraction_analysis_not_finished: The analysis is not yet finished or encountered an error.
select_plots_help: Choose 'Comparison' to see all models together, or select a specific model
no_comparison_plots: No comparison plots found. Displaying all plots...
analysis_running: The scenario is running. Results will appear in the navigation once completed.
pca_help_intro_text: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) reduces data dimensionality while preserving maximum information. It helps visualize relationships between wells and variables and identify groups or trends in the data.
pca_help_scores_1: Each row corresponds to a culture medium
pca_help_scores_2: Shows the **coordinates** of each medium in the reduced space (PC1, PC2, etc.)
pca_help_scores_3: Media close in this space have similar compositions
pca_help_scores_tip: üí° If two media have close coordinates on PC1 and PC2, they react similarly with respect to the measured variables (components, nutrients, etc.).
pca_help_scatter_2: The PC1 and PC2 axes are the two directions that explain the most variance in the data (the percentage is shown on the axes).
pca_help_scatter_3: If several media form a **cluster**, this means they have similar chemical composition.
pca_help_scatter_4: If a medium is **isolated**, it has a composition that differs from other media.
pca_help_scatter_5: Media located on the same side of an axis share common characteristics.
pca_help_scatter_6: Media at opposite extremes of PC1 or PC2 are contrasted on the dominant variables of that axis.
pca_help_biplot_2a: The direction of an arrow indicates the direction in which the variable increases.
pca_help_biplot_2b: The length of the arrow indicates the importance of the variable in constructing the axis (the longer it is, the more it contributes).
pca_help_biplot_2c: Arrows close to each other indicate correlated variables (they vary in the same way).
pca_help_biplot_2d: Opposite arrows indicate negative correlation (when one increases, the other decreases)
pca_help_biplot_3a: Points close to an arrow are rich in this variable (high value).
pca_help_biplot_3b: Points opposite to the arrow are poor in this variable.
pca_help_biplot_3c: Points close together have similar profiles on the main variables.
pca_help_biplot_tip: üí° If a medium is close to the "glucose" arrow, this means it contains a high proportion of glucose or is influenced by this variable.
umap_analysis_not_finished: UMAP analysis is not yet complete or encountered an error.
umap_help_intro_text: UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) is a dimensionality reduction technique that visualizes complex data in 2D or 3D while preserving both local and global data structure.
umap_help_2d_1: Each point represents a culture medium
umap_help_2d_3: Point clusters indicate families of related media
umap_help_3d_1: Provides an additional view to better separate groups
umap_help_3d_2: Helps identify structures hidden in the 2D visualization
umap_help_params_neighbors: Controls the balance between local and global structure (higher = more global structure)
umap_help_params_min_dist: Minimum distance between points in reduced space (lower = more clustered points)
umap_help_params_metric: Method to calculate distance between points
umap_help_clustering_text: If enabled, the K-Means algorithm automatically identifies groups of similar media. Points are colored according to their cluster membership.
existing_selections_info: {count} selection(s) already created. You can create a new one.
medium_umap_info: UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) analysis allows visualizing medium composition data in 2D or 3D, revealing structures and groups of similar media.
medium_umap_no_load_scenario: No data loading scenario found. UMAP analysis is not available.
medium_table_not_available: The medium table (medium_table) is not available in the loading scenario. UMAP analysis is not available.
medium_table_success_info: Make sure the loading scenario ran successfully and produces a 'medium_table' output.
medium_table_check_error: Unable to verify medium table availability: {error}
no_medium_found_qc: No medium found in quality check scenario.
media_to_include_help: Select media to include in UMAP analysis
n_neighbors_help: Controls the balance between local and global structure (higher = more global structure)
distance_metric_help: Metric to calculate distance between points
umap_help_intro: UMAP (Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection) is a dimensionality reduction technique that allows visualizing complex data in 2D or 3D.
umap_help_plot_groups: Point clusters indicate related medium families
umap_help_plot_color: Color distinguishes different media (or clusters if enabled)
umap_help_n_neighbors_desc: Higher preserves global structure, lower preserves local structure
umap_help_min_dist_desc: Controls point dispersion (low = tight groups, high = dispersion)
umap_help_metric_desc: Euclidean for general numeric data, cosine for proportions
umap_help_clustering_desc: Automatically identifies groups of similar media
umap_help_clustering_useful: Useful for discovering natural categories in your data
umap_help_clustering_choice: Number of clusters should be chosen based on your domain knowledge
umap_help_tip_neighbors: Adjust number of neighbors if you want to see more local or global structure
umap_help_tip_clustering: Enable clustering to identify medium families
umap_help_tip_compare: Compare 2D and 3D results for better understanding
causal_effect_info: Causal Effect analysis identifies cause-and-effect relationships between medium composition variables and biological characteristics extracted from growth curves.
metadata_table_unavailable_qc: The metadata table (metadata_table) is not available in the quality check scenario.
series_column_missing: The 'Series' column is missing from the metadata table.
metadata_feature_umap_info: UMAP analysis combines medium composition data (metadata) with characteristics extracted from growth curves for an integrated 2D or 3D visualization.
metadata_table_unavailable_load: The metadata table (metadata_table) is not available in the loading scenario.
metadata_table_check_failed: Unable to verify metadata table availability: {error}
unable_retrieve_qc_output: Unable to retrieve the Quality Check output ResourceSet
scenario_not_successful_yet: The scenario has not completed successfully yet.
no_data_matches_column: No data matches the selected filters for {column}
choose_index_column_help: Choose any column to use as index. Time columns appear first by default.
combined_table_info: The combined table contains **{rows} series** and **{cols} columns** (metadata + features)
visualization_2d_description: 2D visualization of series in metadata + features space
medium_pca_no_load_scenario: No data loading scenario found. PCA analysis is not available.
medium_pca_table_unavailable: The medium table (medium_table) is not available in the loading scenario. PCA analysis is not available.
medium_pca_table_success_info: Make sure the loading scenario ran successfully and produces a 'medium_table' output.
medium_pca_table_check_error: Unable to verify medium table availability: {error}
select_jsondict_warning: Please select a manual constraints JSONDict resource.
longer_bars_info: Longer bars indicate variables that contribute most to model predictions
refresh_page_for_results: Please refresh the page to see results once the analysis is complete.
optimal_components_info: The optimal number of components minimizes RMSE error in cross-validation
vip_importance_threshold_info: Variables with VIP > 1 are considered important for prediction
series_column_missing: The 'Series' column is missing from the metadata table.
analysis_in_progress_refresh: The analysis is in progress. Refresh this page to see results once completed.
metadata_table_not_available_load: The metadata table is not available in the load scenario.
medium_name_column_help: Column containing medium names (used to color points in UMAP)
distance_metric_help: Metric to calculate distance between points
hover_data_help: Select columns to display as metadata on hover over points (Plate, Trial, Date, etc.)
n_neighbors_help: Controls the balance between local and global structure (higher = more global structure)
hover_columns_label: Columns to display on hover over points
umap_analysis_failed: UMAP analysis failed. Please check the scenario logs.
umap_analysis_running: UMAP analysis is running. Please wait...
streamlit_app_resource_unavailable: The Streamlit app resource is not available in the scenario
error_launching_random_forest: Error launching Random Forest Regression scenario: {error}
no_data_matches_filters: No data matches the selected filters for {column}
raw_data_table_help: Table containing the raw BiolectorXT data with Well, Filterset, Time, and Cal columns
folder_metadata_help: Folder containing the BXT.json metadata file from Biolector XT
plate_layout_help: Optional JSONDict with custom well labels and metadata
file_input_mode_help: Choose between uploading new files or selecting existing resources from the lab
missing_raw_data_table: ‚ö†Ô∏è Please upload or select a Raw Data Table
missing_folder_metadata: ‚ö†Ô∏è Please upload or select a Metadata Folder
must_select_correct_resources: Please select resources with the correct types
import_files_info: Upload the required files to start BiolectorXT microplate analysis. The plate_layout is optional for adding custom well labels.
dashboard_description: The BiolectorXT Dashboard is a Streamlit application designed for analyzing and visualizing fermentation data from BiolectorXT microplate readers.
no_biolector_recipe_found: No BiolectorXT recipe found. Click 'Create new recipe' to get started.
processing_detect: Automatic channel detection (Biomass, pH, O2, etc.)
processing_create: Creating one table per well with all channels
processing_missing: Detecting missing values from plate layout
results_cleaned: Cleaned and structured tables per well
results_metadata: Metadata table for ML feature extraction
qc_step_description: Quality check allows you to visualize data distributions and identify outliers for the selected wells.
qc_no_columns_available: No columns available for quality checks.
qc_max_missing_percentage_help: Wells with more than this percentage of missing data will be filtered
qc_required_columns_help: Wells must have data for all these columns
qc_min_data_points_description: Ensure wells have a minimum number of data points for specific columns.
qc_min_points_help: Minimum number of data points required for this column
qc_action_help: What to do if validation fails
qc_add_quality_tags_help: Add tags indicating which wells passed/failed quality checks
qc_cannot_retrieve_data: Cannot retrieve data from selection scenario
qc_cannot_retrieve_subsampled_data: Cannot retrieve subsampled data from selection scenario
qc_tips_content: Quality checks help you identify and filter outliers or incomplete wells. Configure range validations, missing data thresholds, and minimum data points requirements to ensure data quality.
qc_launch_success: Quality check launched successfully! Scenario ID: {id}
qc_scenario_running_info: The quality check scenario is running. Results will appear once completed.
selecting_well_info: Selecting a well selects it across all plates. Hover to see data from all plates.
selected_wells_summary: Selected: {unique_wells} unique wells √ó {num_plates} plates = {total} total selections
